sections.summary: Chaos Theory in action. A Fractal is a recurring geometric pattern showing a turning point. A 'Buy Fractal' is a series of 5 bars where the lowest low is in the middle, flanked by two higher lows. It marks a potential bottom.
sections.deep_dive: Markets are self-similar across timeframes. A fractal on a 1-minute chart looks like one on a monthly chart. We don't trade the Fractal itself; we trade the *breakout* of the Fractal High or Low. It detects structure in the chaos.
sections.council_debate: {"geopolitics": "History repeats, but not exactly. It rhymes. Geopolitical crises are fractals. A local skirmish (small fractal) often predicts a larger war (large fractal) if the structure is identical. We map conflict intensity using fractal geometry.", "macro": "Economic cycles are fractal. The 4-year business cycle is nested inside a 10-year debt cycle, inside a 50-year Kondratieff wave. We identify which 'Wave' we are in to allocate capital. Currently, we are in a 'Winter' fractal.", "quant": "We filter noise. A fractal is a local extrema. By connecting fractals, we draw trendlines that are mathematically significant, not subjective. sections.forecast_risks: Lag and Repainting. A fractal needs 2 bars *after* the middle bar to confirm. It is a lagging indicator. Also, false breakouts are common in sideways markets.
sections.gms_conclusion: Don't guess the turn. Let the Fractal mark the turn, then trade the momentum.
